meanings.definition: To make a false statement under oath.
meanings.sent1: He forswore his innocence in court.
meanings.sent2: She forswore her promise to tell the truth.
meanings.sent3: The parrot forswore its usual squawks and mimicked the judge instead.
meanings.sent4: The politician forswore his loyalty to the people for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The witness forswore with such conviction that everyone believed the lie.

meanings.sent1: They forswore their allegiance to the old king.
meanings.sent2: He forswore his inheritance to live a simple life.
meanings.sent3: The cat forswore its favorite toy in favor of a shiny new one.
meanings.sent4: She forswore her bad habits and embraced a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The company forswore its unethical practices and committed to change.

meanings.sent1: He forswore his testimony to protect his friend.
meanings.sent2: She forswore her involvement in the prank.
meanings.sent3: The dog forswore its innocence by wagging its tail guiltily.
meanings.sent4: The student forswore knowing the answer to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent5: The suspect forswore his guilt despite the evidence against him.
